newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times front page- April 22.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times front page- April 22.

text.p: The New York Times reported the following stories on its front page Tuesday:
* President Clinton has approved a ban on new U.S. investment in Myanmar because of human rights abuses by that government.
* Two New Jersey teenagers were arrested and charged with the intricately plotted and brutal murders of two pizza delivery men.
* Public sentiment in the United States has turned against the tobacco companies, giving politicians new impetus to oppose the industry, especially at the state and local levels.
* A Queens, New York house where three men died in a fire had been illegally converted to provide cheap rooms to immigrants, New York City officials said.
* As floods ravaged Grand Forks, N.D., officials said it would be at least three weeks before residents could return.
* With Britain's Labor party shifting its focus to England's middle class and away from its traditional working class roots, many of the country's poorer areas feel they are being ignored.
* A rocket carrying a capsule of Timothy Leary's ashes and those of 23 others was launched from the Grand Canary Island off the Moroccan coast.
